Docs.summary: Adds a target languages of translation.
Docs.remarks: When speech synthesis is used and several target languages are specified for translation, the speech will be synthesized only for the first language.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.CognitiveServices.Speech.SpeechTranslationConfig FromAuthorizationToken (string authorizationToken, string region);
.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.CognitiveServices.Speech.SpeechTranslationConfig FromAuthorizationToken(string authorizationToken, string region) cil managed
Public Shared Function FromAuthorizationToken (authorizationToken As String, region As String) As SpeechTranslationConfig
static member FromAuthorizationToken : string * string -> Microsoft.CognitiveServices.Speech.SpeechTranslationConfig

Docs.param: Region identifier for the given authorization token.
Docs.summary: Creates an instance of the speech translation config with specified authorization token and region.
Docs.remarks: The caller needs to ensure that the authorization token is valid. Before the authorization token expires, you need to refresh it in the recognizer by passing a new valid token to the recognizer.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.CognitiveServices.Speech.SpeechTranslationConfig FromEndpoint (Uri endpoint);
.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.CognitiveServices.Speech.SpeechTranslationConfig FromEndpoint(class System.Uri endpoint) cil managed
Public Shared Function FromEndpoint (endpoint As Uri) As SpeechTranslationConfig
static member FromEndpoint : Uri -> Microsoft.CognitiveServices.Speech.SpeechTranslationConfig

Docs.param: The service endpoint to connect to.
Docs.summary: Creates an instance of the speech translation config with specified endpoint. Added in 1.5.0
Docs.remarks: * This method is only used for a non-standard resource path or parameter overrides. To change the host name with standard resource paths, use **FromHost** instead. * The query parameters specified in the endpoint URI are not changed, even if they are set by any other APIs. For example, if the recognition language is defined in URI as query parameter "language=de-DE", and the property SpeechRecognitionLanguage is set to "en-US", the language setting in URI takes precedence, and the effective language is "de-DE". Only the parameters that are not specified in the endpoint URI can be set by other APIs. * If the endpoint requires a subscription key for authentication, use FromEndpoint(System.Uri, string) to pass the subscription key as parameter. To use an authorization token with FromEndpoint, use this method to create a SpeechTranslationConfig instance, and then set the AuthorizationToken property on the created SpeechTranslationConfig instance.

Docs.param: The service endpoint to connect to.
The subscription key. To create or find your key and region, see [Find keys and region](/azure/cognitive-services/speech-service/overview#find-keys-and-region).
Docs.summary: Creates an instance of the speech translation config with specified endpoint and subscription key.
Docs.remarks: * This method is only used for a non-standard resource path or parameter overrides. To change the host name with standard resource paths, use **FromHost** instead. * The query parameters specified in the endpoint URI are not changed, even if they are set by any other APIs. For example, if the recognition language is defined in URI as query parameter "language=de-DE", and the property SpeechRecognitionLanguage is set to "en-US", the language setting in URI takes precedence, and the effective language is "de-DE". Only the parameters that are not specified in the endpoint URI can be set by other APIs. * If the endpoint requires a subscription key for authentication, use FromEndpoint(System.Uri, string) to pass the subscription key as parameter. To use an authorization token with FromEndpoint, use this method to create a SpeechTranslationConfig instance, and then set the AuthorizationToken property on the created SpeechTranslationConfig instance.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.CognitiveServices.Speech.SpeechTranslationConfig FromHost (Uri host);
.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.CognitiveServices.Speech.SpeechTranslationConfig FromHost(class System.Uri host) cil managed
Public Shared Function FromHost (host As Uri) As SpeechTranslationConfig
static member FromHost : Uri -> Microsoft.CognitiveServices.Speech.SpeechTranslationConfig

Docs.param: The service host to connect to. Format is `protocol://host:port` where `:port` is optional.
Docs.summary: Creates an instance of the speech translation config with specified host. Added in 1.8.0
Docs.remarks:
This method is intended only for users who use a non-default service host. Standard resource path will be assumed. For services with a non-standard resource path or no path at all, use **FromEndpoint** instead.
To use an authorization token with **FromHost**, use this method to create a **SpeechTranslationConfig** instance, and then set the **AuthorizationToken** property on the created **SpeechTranslationConfig** instance.
Notes: * Query parameters are not allowed in the host URI and must be set by other APIs. * If the host requires a subscription key for authentication, use **FromHost(System.Uri, string)** to pass the subscription key as parameter.

Docs.remarks: This method is intended only for users who use a non-default service host. Standard resource path will be assumed. For services with a non-standard resource path or no path at all, use FromEndpoint instead.
